column3: Agree that this is an improvement, but do we really need zillions of pulls for this...\n
@laanwj No, but I think that that particular change was not a good one. The way it was is fine, this is better, but IMHO that change was a negative one.\n

Added another commit to make a similar change to the init.cpp message for failure to lock data directory, after it was pointed out to me in IRC that the port message is far less common than the datadir one for normal, day-to-day users that might be confused by the change.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/9e2872c234d9b4fc7ae2b69326fe9610f7b18264 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
